xwikidoc.name: Translations
xwikidoc.creator: XWiki.Admin
xwikidoc.author: XWiki.Admin
xwikidoc.content:
## wizard ## batchimport.import.title=Import data in application "{0}" ## Step upload file ## batchimport.import.choosefile.title=Choose a file batchimport.import.choosefile.description=Choose the file to import data from, accepted formats are CSV and Excel. You can upload a new file by using the upload file form under. batchimport.import.choosefile.fileupload=Upload a new file batchimport.import.choosefile.fileselect=Choose the file to import from batchimport.import.choosefile.uploadfile=Upload batchimport.import.choosefile.previous=None batchimport.import.choosefile.next=Select file ## Step mapping ## batchimport.import.mapping.title=Column mapping batchimport.import.mapping.description=Choose how to fill in the data of the application from the columns in the uploaded file. Note that data types should match, i.e. the columns that you choose for numeric, date or boolean fields should be convertible to those types. Also see the options in the column to the right for some adjustments that can facilitate conversion. The next step offers a preview of the association and how the data in the source file will be processed, so you can do multiple back and forths until you are satisfied with the result. batchimport.import.mapping.fields=Class fields batchimport.import.mapping.columns=Columns in the file batchimport.import.mapping.none=- batchimport.import.mapping.doc.name=Document name batchimport.import.mapping.doc.title=Document title batchimport.import.mapping.doc.space=Document space batchimport.import.mapping.doc.parent=Document parent batchimport.import.mapping.doc.content=Document content batchimport.import.mapping.doc.file=Document attachments batchimport.import.mapping.doc.tags=Document tags batchimport.import.mapping.error.exception=An error occurred while trying to read the columns from the file: batchimport.import.mapping.error.noexception=An unknown error occurred while trying to read the columns from the file. batchimport.import.mapping.localelanguage.description=By default, the columns mapped on application fields of type number are parsed as "unformatted" numbers (decimal separator is '.' (dot) and no other non-digit character is accepted). However, if your source file contains formatted numbers, you can indicate here the localization used to process these numbers (e.g. in French, a number would be written as "1 235,54", using comma as decimal separator and space to group hundreds together for integer values). Using a localization will also make percent values and per mill values be interpreted as numeric values (e.g. '60%' will become '60'). Language should be filled in by its two letter code, e.g. 'en', 'fr', 'de', etc. batchimport.import.mapping.localelanguage=Localization language batchimport.import.mapping.defaultdateformat.description=By default, if a column in the file is mapped on an application field of type date, the values in the column will try to be interpreted using the format specified in the date field. However, if you have values that are using a different format, you can specify here the fallback format to be used for values which cannot be interpreted using the format specified in the date field. Note that the format applies to individual values, not to a whole column (if a value on a column cannot be interpreted using the date format of the field, only that value will be interpreted using the format specified here, not all the values on that column). The format should given as a pattern by the rules described here http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html . batchimport.import.mapping.defaultdateformat=Default date format batchimport.import.mapping.listseparator.description=If a file column is mapped on an application field of type list with "multiple select" checked, the import system will try to interpret the value in the field as a potential list of values rather than a single value. The splitting of the value will be done using this character as ennumeration separator. By default, it is ',' (comma). batchimport.import.mapping.listseparator=List separator batchimport.import.mapping.previous=Change file batchimport.import.mapping.next=Preview mapping ## Step mapping preview ## batchimport.import.preview.title=Preview of data mapping and parsing batchimport.import.preview.description=Following is a preview of the first 10 lines of the source file, with the values for the fields as they will be interpreted by the import system. A warning icon means that there is an error on processing that value and **the whole row will be skipped on import**, an empty cell means that there is no value in the input file for the column associated to that field. You can go back and forth between mapping and preview until you get the result you want. \\\\Note that the errors presented here refer to only the 10 first rows, if you need a complete verification of the file, advance to the import step and perform a simulation. batchimport.import.mapping.doc.reference=Document full name batchimport.import.preview.errorlog=Errors on data parsing (for the lines above) batchimport.import.preview.fulllog=Full log (for the lines above) batchimport.import.preview.error.exception=An error occurred while generating the data mapping preview. batchimport.import.preview.error.noexception=An unknown error occurred while generating the data mapping preview. batchimport.import.preview.previous=Change mapping batchimport.import.preview.next=Confirm mapping ## Step overwrite ## batchimport.import.overwrite.title=Data deduplication and overwrite batchimport.import.overwrite.deduplication.explanation=If by any chance, the column chose for document name does not contain unique names, what should happen to the **duplicate rows**? batchimport.import.overwrite.deduplication.option.skip=Ignore batchimport.import.overwrite.deduplication.option.update=Update: use the data as part of the other rows with the same document name (if the same column is set on multiple rows, the last one will win). batchimport.import.overwrite.deduplication.option.generate_new=Generate a new document name, by adding a number at the end of the document name batchimport.import.overwrite.explanation=If then, for the document name built as indicated above, a document already exists in the wiki with that name, what should we to the **existing document in the wiki**? batchimport.import.overwrite.option.skip=Leave unchanged (ignore data from the file) batchimport.import.overwrite.option.update=Update with the data coming from the file (the fields mapped on the columns of the file will be updated, the rest will remain unchanged) batchimport.import.overwrite.option.replace=Replace with the data coming from the file (the existing document will be deleted and a new one will be created instead, containing only the data in the file) batchimport.import.overwrite.option.generate_new=Generate a new document name, by adding a number at the end of the document name built as indicated above. Note that 2 subsequent imports with this option checked will not yield the same results since the document names used depend on the documents existing on the wiki. batchimport.import.overwrite.previous=Back to mapping preview batchimport.import.overwrite.next=Do an import simulation ## Step simulation ## batchimport.import.importsimulation.title=Import simulation batchimport.import.importsimulation.errorlog=Errors batchimport.import.importsimulation.fulllog=Full log batchimport.import.importsimulation.error.exception=An error occurred while executing import simulation: batchimport.import.importsimulation.error.noexception=An unknown error occurred while executing import simulation. batchimport.import.importsimulation.previous=Change overwrite options batchimport.import.importsimulation.next=Import ## Step real import ## batchimport.import.import.title=Import batchimport.import.import.description= batchimport.import.import.errorlog=Errors batchimport.import.import.fulllog=Full log batchimport.import.import.error.exception=An error occurred while importing data: batchimport.import.import.error.noexception=An unknown error occurred while importing data. batchimport.import.import.backtowebhome=Go to "{0} Welcome" ## delete existing data ## batchimport.delete.title=Delete existing data of application "{0}" batchimport.delete.success=Successfully deleted data: batchimport.delete.success.backtowebhome=Back to {0} batchimport.delete.error.exception=An error occurred while deleting data: batchimport.delete.error.noexception=An unknown error occurred while deleting data. batchimport.delete.error.backtowebhome=Back to {0} batchimport.delete.confirmation.description=Are you sure you want to delete all the data of the application "{0}"? batchimport.delete.confirmation.submit=Delete batchimport.delete.confirmation.cancel=Cancel batchimport.delete.error.noclass=Cannot delete data: no type of data was specified.
## logs ## batchimport.log.checkingzip=Checking zip file {0} batchimport.log.cannotopenzip=Could not open zip file {0} batchimport.log.checkingdatadir=Checking data directory {0} batchimport.log.cannotopendatadir=Could not open data directory {0} batchimport.log.import=Line {0}: Imported row {1} in page [[{2}]] without file. batchimport.log.simimport=Line {0}: Ready to import row {1} in page {2} without file. batchimport.log.ignoreduplicate=Line {0}: Ignore {1} because page name was already used in this import. batchimport.log.ignoreemptypagename=Line {0}: Ignore {1} because page name is empty or could not be built. batchimport.log.done=Processing finished. batchimport.log.toreplace=Line {0}: Removed document {2} to replace with line {1} batchimport.log.simtoreplace=Line {0}: Removing document {2} to replace with line {1} batchimport.log.ignorealreadyexists=Line {0}: Cannot import row {1} because page {2} already exists. batchimport.log.simimportfileok=Line {0}: Ready to import row {1} in page {2} and imported file {3} is ok. batchimport.log.importduplicateattach=Line {0}: Imported row {1} in page [[{2}]] without file {3} since it already exists. batchimport.log.importfiledir=Line {0}: Imported row {1} in page [[{2}]] and attached all files in the {3} directory. batchimport.log.importofficefail=Line {0}: Imported row {1} in page [[{2}]] but failed importing office file {3} into content. batchimport.log.importoffice=Line {0}: Imported row {1} in page [[{2}]] and imported office file {3} into content. batchimport.log.importnooffice=Line {0}: Imported row {1} in page [[{2}]] and did not need to import the office file. batchimport.log.importcannotreadfile=Line {0}: Imported row {1} in page [[{2}]] and failed to read the office file. batchimport.log.errornofile=Line {0}: Cannot import row {1} in page {2} because imported file {3} does not exist. batchimport.log.simimportnofile=Line {0}: Ready to import row {1} in page {2} (no file attached). batchimport.log.importnofile=Line {0}: Imported row {1} in page [[{2}]].
batchimport.log.importfail=Line {0}: Failed to import line {1} to document {2} because of unknown error: "{3}"
batchimport.log.delete=Deleted document {0} from wiki {1} batchimport.log.deletefail=Failed to delete document {0} from wiki {1} becauseof unknown error : "{2}"
## validation errors ## batchimport.log.errorvalidationlength=Line {0}: Validation error on row {1}: value "{5}" on column "{4}" is too long for field "{3}" (max length is {6}). batchimport.log.errorvalidationlengthdocfullname=Line {0}: Validation error on row {1}: full name of document (\"{2}\") too long (max length is {3}). batchimport.log.errorvalidationnoobject=Line {0}: Validation error on row {1}: cannot create object of type {3} in document {2}. batchimport.log.errorvalidationtypeboolean=Line {0}: Validation error on row {1}: cannot convert value "{5}" on column "{4}" to boolean for field "{3}" (accepted values are ''true'', ''false'', ''1'' or ''0''). batchimport.log.errorvalidationtypeinteger=Line {0}: Validation error on row {1}: cannot convert value "{5}" on column "{4}" to integer for field "{3}" (incorrect format or value out of range). batchimport.log.errorvalidationtypelong=Line {0}: Validation error on row {1}: cannot convert value "{5}" on column "{4}" to long for field "{3}" (incorrect format or value out of range). batchimport.log.errorvalidationtypefloat=Line {0}: Validation error on row {1}: cannot convert value "{5}" on column "{4}" to float for field "{3}" (incorrect format or value out of range). batchimport.log.errorvalidationtypedouble=Line {0}: Validation error on row {1}: cannot convert value "{5}" on column "{4}" to double for field "{3}" (incorrect format or value out of range). batchimport.log.errorvalidationtypedate=Line {0}: Validation error on row {1}: cannot convert value "{5}" on column "{4}" to date for field "{3}" (accepted format is {6}).
batchimport.log.donepreview=Generating mapping preview finished.
